channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 12 Review: Beautiful and Baffling
item.description: As gorgeous as it is, Microsoft’s latest 2-in-1 Windows tablet is held back by baffling pricing decisions.

item.title: xAI blames Grok’s obsession with white genocide on an ‘unauthorized modification’
item.description: xAI blamed an “unauthorized modification” for a bug in its AI-powered Grok chatbot that caused Grok to repeatedly refer to “white genocide in South Af...

item.title: Shark CryoGlow Review: Chill Out
item.description: The FDA-cleared LED mask features targeted modes for helping reduce fine lines and blemishes, but if you're consistent, the benefits go far deeper.

item.title: Epic Games says Apple is blocking Fortnite from the US and EU App Stores
item.description: Epic Games claims that Apple is blocking its Fortnite app from the U.S. and EU App Stores. After winning a decisive victory for app developers in a le...

item.title: Sam Altman’s goal for ChatGPT to remember ‘your whole life’ is both exciting and disturbing
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman laid out a big vision for the future of ChatGPT at an AI event hosted by VC firm Sequoia earlier this month. When asked by one a...

item.title: Chipotle president Jack Hartung joins Tesla’s board ahead of Tesla Diner launch
item.description: Veteran Chipotle executive Jack Hartung was appointed a member of Tesla’s board of directors Thursday, according to a Tesla filing with the SEC. Hartu...

item.title: Does Your City Use Chlorine or Chloramine to Treat Its Water?
item.description: Different cities use different water treatments, and this can affect how filters work on your water.

item.title: The Nuclear Company raises $46M to develop massive reactor sites
item.description: The funding round arrives as tech companies and utilities are struggling to secure power for data centers.

item.title: The Best Ergonomic Mouse (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Wrists cramping? Skip the gaming mouse and snag one of these WIRED-tested ergonomic options instead.

item.title: No, Graduates: AI Hasn't Ended Your Career Before It Starts
item.description: In a commencement speech at Temple University, I shared my views on how new college graduates can compete with powerful artificial intelligence.
